**ENGLISH III—English for Science & Technology** (College of Science)

**Spring Semester 2021**

**Mondays, 13:20—15:10, Gong-Guan Campus S Building 306**

**科技英文** **一** **6-7** **公館** **S 306**

**ENGLISH III—English for Science & Technology** (Main Campus)

**Spring Semester 2021**

**Thursdays, 10:20—12:10, Main Campus, Jeng Building 404**

**科技英文** **四****3-4** **本部** **正****404**

Instructor:  Jean E. Curran, Office: 誠714

Office Hours: Mondays, 16:00 – 18:00; Tuesdays 10:00 – 12:00

Email: **curran.jean@gmail.com**

Homework Email: **curran.jean.homework@gmail.com**
==================================================

**Goal**: The goal of this course is to help students continue to develop their English proficiency so that they will be better able to comprehend and use English in the courses they study in their major and in their daily lives. Through a series of readings, discussions, and projects, students will work on developing their critical thinking, speaking, writing, and listening skills.  

**Objectives**:

1.  To help students continue to develop the skills they will need to employ when reading, listening, writing about, or discussing materials related to science and technology that have been published in English.

1.  To teach students to think critically about the issues addressed in the readings and in class.

1.  To provide classroom opportunities for the discussion of thoughts and ideas generated from students’ use of critical thinking skills.

1.  To develop students’ speaking skills so that they can effectively prepare and deliver a response in English.

1.  To provide opportunities through the use of written tasks to allow students to show their understanding of the course content.

1.  To give students opportunities to apply English skills to tasks required for their own majors.    

1.  To introduce students to some of the online resources available in English that are devoted to science and technology topics. 

1.  To provide students with opportunities to explore other materials on science and technology topics that are of global interest.

**Organization of the Course**

1.  Prior to class, students should prepare any assigned materials.
2.  In class, students will be asked to work in groups to complete exercises related to the topic, discuss questions about the material, use their critical thinking to formulate additional discussion questions, and write a response to one of the discussion or critical thinking questions.

**Requirements**
================

**1.  Attendance and Preparation**

It is very important that students attend class on a regular basis and that students prepare any homework assignments.  If you miss class frequently, points will be deducted from your final grade for the course, and it is possible that you may fail the course.  Please arrive for class on time. Continually arriving for class late will be viewed as an absence.  

**2.  Participation**

It is expected that students will be active participants in the learning process.  

**3.  Projects**

Students will be asked to complete a number of individual and group projects.

**4\.  Other**: Phones, Breaks, Arrangement of the Classroom

                  Classroom Tasks (group)                                          30%

                 Take-Home Assignment (individual)                         15%
